item.description:
We can have a few locations, but this location will be near Errol, NH. /Oxford, Maine at Alexsandra's lake house on Lake Aziscohos Maine.


The limit is set at 15 so sign up if you definitely can come, we will try to car pool to this remote location. 4 wheel drive is recommended for the logging road to her place. There is limited loft sleeping space and room for 4 tents.

This is lake front so kayaks are welcome. The accomodations are bring your own gear and food. No electricity. There is a kitchen with propane stove and refrigerator. Headlamps and battery lanterns are needed to get around at night.



Take 93 North to exit 35 onto Rt. 3, Go through Lancaster to Rt. 110 in Stark. Take Rt. 110A to Rt.16 North. Stay on Rt. 16 to Errol. In Errol you will take a left (still on Rt. 16) and head towards Rangeley, Maine. We are about 18 miles from Errol. Black Brook Cove Campground sign is on the right side of the road. Take a left turn onto the Lincoln Pond Road.

Gear list: Binoculars, hiking gear.sunblock, swimsuit, towel, optional mountain bike, Maine fishing license available at the Cove campground, beverages, veggies/ protein or marshmallows for grilling. Bugs should be done for the season, and brave swimmers would be advised to pack earplugs to limit earaches.

Her camp provides coffee/tea, lighting, fishing tackle and bait, refrigeration and cooking appliances for meals, and limited bed space on a half acre. There is space for about 4 tents outside. I have a fishing boat for anyone interested in a boat tour of the 14 mile waters in the front yard.

Because of the distance into camp, we can meet inbound campers at the Blackbrook Cove campground For drivers of cars with sufficient ground clearance, DIRECTIONS ARE IN YOUR QUESTIONEER :: RECOMMENDED to travel together from BBC campground! for balloons or other markers.
item.how_to_find_us: RSVP and set up arrangments to meet
item.name: Perseids meteor shower campout:: Maine
